topic.title: Recordings from Jan 31 2025
topic.text:
GIS Programming
https://ufl.zoom.us/rec/share/YRScju5my_U2Vc_fc-PDRILnRUUHG5hsLlgqeTFr4LJ-V54njbs7vUTGjjW5TbKI.KvwuLE36NmuA2clK?startTime=1738334280000
Dr. Sounny welcomed the class and addressed challenges with Azure JS, VS code setup, and the use of open-source GIS tools like QGIS. He discussed various GIS systems, including QGIS and Leaflet, and highlighted recent changes in Esri's services, including the introduction of a new location platform dashboard and developer credentials. Dr. Sounny also touched on the importance of remote sensing, cloud-based computing, and the process of setting up API keys for projects, offering guidance on troubleshooting and development.

Remote Sensing

https://ufl.zoom.us/rec/share/YRScju5my_U2Vc_fc-PDRILnRUUHG5hsLlgqeTFr4LJ-V54njbs7vUTGjjW5TbKI.KvwuLE36NmuA2clK?startTime=1738335381000 

Dr. Sounny discussed the progress and challenges in remote sensing, particularly using Google Earth Engine, and its applications in visualizing historical information and observing Mars. He explained the use of programming concepts, data analysis techniques like NDVI and Boolean logic, and their potential applications in various fields such as city planning and engineering. The discussion also covered topics like glacier retreats, land cover classification, and the implications of impervious surfaces on water runoff in urban areas.
